CatDescriptText: Mrs. Anthony Tarullo, 1440 Straka Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 2, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe Negroes, who get public assistance, do more cheating than whites?" answer reads: "I've had no personal experience with the persons cheating on public assistance. However, I might say that I have gone to a public school attended by children of parents on relief, and from what I saw, I believe that neither side does the greater amount of cheating."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. Anthony Tarullo wearing earrings, light colored blouse, light colored boucle coat, and light colored gloves, holding paper bag and dark handbag, standing on Liberty Avenue, with Thrift Drugs in background
